title: 109_s784
content: The Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2005, also known as the Act, covers marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services under Part B of the Medicare program. The Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2005 expands Medicare coverage to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services. The Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2005 expands Medicare coverage to include marriage and family therapist services for the diagnosis and treatment of mental illnesses, as defined by State law. Marriage and family therapists must possess a master's or doctoral degree and have performed at least 2 years of post-degree clinical work to qualify for licensure. The term 'mental health counselor services' refers to services provided by a mental health counselor for diagnosing and treating mental illnesses as authorized by state law. This includes services that would typically be covered if provided by a physician, as long as no facility or provider charges for them. The term 'mental health counselor' refers to an individual with a master's or doctor's degree in mental health counseling, at least 2 years of supervised practice, and licensure in states that require it. Payment for these services is covered under part B of the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services for payment at 80 percent of the actual charge or 75 percent of the amount paid to a psychologist. The Social Security Act is amended to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services for payment, excluding them from the skilled nursing facility prospective payment system. Marriage and family therapists and mental health counselors are also included as practitioners for assignment of claims. The Social Security Act is amended to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services for payment in certain healthcare settings. This expands coverage to rural health clinics, federally qualified health centers, and hospice programs. The Social Security Act is amended to include marriage and family therapist services in discharge planning for post-hospital services. The effective date for these amendments is January 1, 2006.
